message: I agree with all of this...however, I think that if we had a true living wage, we could actually lower capital gains and corporate taxes. If we had a living wage that would generate enough tax revenue to fund the government, we wouldn't need to tax investment or incorporation. If we had a real living wage, I could personally support eliminating capital gains taxes, and reducing corporate taxes down to just under 10% (to cover environmental liability, contributions to social security/universal medical care/unemployment insurance).
shrinked_message: I agree with all of this...however, I think that if we had a true living wage, we could actually lower capital gains and corporate taxes. If we had a living wage that would generate enough tax revenue to fund the government, we wouldn't need to tax investment or incorporation. If we had a real living wage, I could personally support eliminating capital gains taxes, and reducing corporate taxes down to just under 10% (to cover environmental liability, contributions to social security/universal medical care/unemployment insurance).
